duck: Bol loop - In mathematics and abstract algebra, a Bol loop is an algebraic structure generalizing the notion of group.
Division ring – a ring in which every non-zero element has a multiplicative inverse
Semigroup – an algebraic structure consisting of a set together with an associative binary operation
Monoid – a semigroup with an identity element
Small Latin squares and quasigroups - Below the Latin squares and quasigroups of some small orders are considered.
In mathematics, especially in abstract algebra, a quasigroup is an algebraic structure resembling a group in the sense that " division " is always possible.
Planar ternary ring – has an additive and multiplicative loop structure
In mathematics, especially in abstract algebra, a quasigroup is an algebraic structure resembling a group in the sense that "division" is always possible.

wiki.text:
In mathematics, especially in abstract algebra, a 'quasigroup' is an algebraic
structure resembling a group in the sense that "division" is always possible.
Quasigroups differ from groups mainly in that they need not be associative.

A quasigroup with an identity element is called a 'loop'.
wiki.title: quasigroup
